chargeHist.descr: Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kurt V Laufenberg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kurt V Laufenberg is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kurt V Laufenberg was found guilty of Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.09(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IID restriction effective upon licensure for 5 yrs.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.

Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Do not drive a motor vehicle without valid DL and approval of agent.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with DL's family unless they initiate & PO agent approves. No alcohol in residence.

For 6 mo after release that there should be a sobrietor installed in def's residence.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order. Bond to apply.

Status conference on September 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant in court with Attorney Stephen Jay Eisenberg.  Jonathon Gary Kaiser appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

AMENDED CASH BOND - CONDITIONS MODIFIED
$5,000.  per case - Cash previously posted.
  - Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
  - Defendant shall be within his residence between the hours of 9 p.m. and 6 a.m. unless accompanied by a parent or legal guardian, unless at, or traveling to or from, school, treatment, or employment as approved by BMP in writing.
  - Defendant may operate a motor vehicle only for travel to and from work, including job work sites, and for no other prupose - provided the defendant has a valid driver's license.
  - Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
  - The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $5,000 per case. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his release from jail.
 - If the defendant fails to comply with Dane County Bail Monitoring, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $25,000 per case, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. If Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM. If Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public.The Defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his release from jail. Defendant is ordered to cooperate with DCBM.

  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.

- Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall be within their residence between the hours of 9 p.m. and 6 a.m. unless at, or traveling to or from, school, treatment, or employment as approved by BMP in writing. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle at anytime.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the def's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $5,000 per case. If the def posts cash bail, the def must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the def's release. The def shall report to DCBM by 9:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.    If the def fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $25,000 per case, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. If Def posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM. If Def is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public.The Def shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. Def is ordered to cooperate with DCBM.
